paper_abstract: The research in the parameterized 3D-MATCHING problem has yielded a number of new algorithmic techniques and an impressive list of improved algorithms. In this article, a new deterministic algorithm for the problem is developed that integrates and improves a number of known techniques, including greedy localization, dynamic programming, and color coding. The new algorithm, which either constructs a matching of k triples in a given triple set or correctly reports that no such a matching exists, runs in time O*(2.80(3k)), improving a long list of previous algorithms for the problem.
paper_title: Iterative Expansion and Color Coding: An Improved Algorithm for 3D-Matching
